Session with Moti: Reviewed complete tabs architecture for Sementix multi-chat system

Key findings:
- Ultra-modular architecture with ChatTabManager orchestrating 7 core modules + 6 coordinators
- Placeholder system ('waiting_for_id') allows instant UI feedback while Extension generates real UUID
- Per-chat DOM isolation using CSS visibility (no DOM recreation on switch)
- ChatStore maintains complete per-tab state (messages, provider, sessionId, streaming status, button state)
- AutoTabCreator handles lazy tab creation from Extension events
- PlaceholderTransitionCoordinator manages 4-step transition from placeholder to real chatId
- Smart message routing via ChatIdFilter and MessageManagerRouter
- Extension-UI sync via chatId in all events

Current status: Most features working, some edge cases in sessionId sync and performance optimizations needed

Next work: Will focus on isolated tabs improvements

Deep-dive analysis requested by Moti on 4 key improvement areas in tabs system:
1. SessionId sync issues across message types
2. No message pagination (memory concerns)
3. No visual feedback during placeholder transition
4. Edge cases with fast message sends

Reviewed: SessionTracker, SessionIdChunkExtractor, ChatStore, PlaceholderTransitionCoordinator, DOMTransitionManager
Understanding: sessionId per-chat extraction working, but some message types may bypass. Messages array unbounded in ChatStore. Transition is instant with no UI feedback. Race conditions possible with rapid sends.
Explaining ChatStore architecture to Moti - how per-tab state management works with Map<chatId, ChatData> structure, message isolation, and switching mechanics
